pageContext.claim: “We still are scarred all over our country where you have empty factories, empty buildings, just by the thousands. And millions of jobs were lost. Big portions of our auto industry was lost to Mexico and other places.”
pageContext.analysis: Around the time NAFTA was implemented, the U.S. did lose 4 million manufacturing jobs and thousands of manufacturing plants, but there were a number of factors that contributed to this shift. So while the job losses were concurrent with NAFTA's implementation, it's misleading to say they were because of NAFTA.
